title: Calories in Spam
meta_description: Discover calories in spam for a standard serving, including full nutrition facts like fat, protein, sodium, and quick preparation tweaks to adjust intake.
assumptions: Standard Hormel Spam classic, canned pork with ham; 2 oz (56 g) serving, heated or straight from can, no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, product type (e.g., lite, turkey), serving size, and preparation. Check product labels for accurate details.

quick_answer.text: A 56 g serving of Spam provides 180 kcal, 7 g protein, and is high in sodium at 790 mg.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pan-fried with 1 tsp vegetable oil per 100 g
Topped with 1 tbsp ketchup per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in spam per serving?
faqs.a: About 180 kcal in a standard 56 g serving of classic Spam.
Yes, 16 g total fat per 56 g serving, including 6 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in spam?
faqs.a: 790 mg per 56 g serving, which is significant—opt for low-sodium versions if needed.

faqs.q: Does spam have a lot of protein?
faqs.a: 7 g protein per 56 g serving, making it a decent source for its size.
Very few—only 1 g total carbs per 56 g serving, with 0 g fiber and sugars.
